conclusion: Determine the maximum distance between Car A and Car B at any time between the two instances when they are side by side.
Car A accelerates uniformly from 0 to 40 m/s in 10 seconds.
Acceleration of Car A is 4 m/s².
Constant speed of Car A after 10 seconds is 40 m/s.
Car B accelerates uniformly from 0 to 40 m/s in 20 seconds.
Acceleration of Car B is 2 m/s².
Velocity of Car B at any time t is given by v_B = 2t.
Position of Car A for 0 ≤ t ≤ 10 is s_A(t) = 2t².
Position of Car A for 10 < t ≤ 30 is s_A(t) = 40t - 200.
Position of Car B is s_B(t) = t².
Find time t when s_A(t) - s_B(t) is maximum for 10 < t ≤ 30.
At t = 20, s_A(20) = 600 meters and s_B(20) = 400 meters.
